thesis.description: The tract of Lissauer has long been associated with pain, but the exact pathway of this important sensation has been far from clear. [...]

thesis.description: There are many factors which cause a variation in the baking strength of wheat flour, i.e. the capacity of a flour to yield large light, fine-textured loaves of bread. Above all, the quality of the wheat from which the flour is milled is of prime importance. [...]

thesis.description: In the biographical sketch of Christopher Marlowe which prefaces his 1818 edition of The Jew of Malta, Oxberry wrote: "Of his (Marlowe's) family we know absolutely nothing; their very names are forgotten...Ali the genius or Marlowe...has not had the power to save the records of his life from oblivion." [...]

thesis.description: The North China Plain is an important section of the earth's land surface, for its sheer size, its long written history, and its ability to support a dense population. It is part of the Great Plain of China, one of the world's largest agricultural lowlands, comprising the land between the mountains and the sea, the valleys of the Yellow, Hwai, Yangtze, and many smaller streams. [...]
thesis.creator: Creighton, Phyllis.
thesis.subject: Geography.
China -- Geography.
thesis.title: The north China plain : a regional study.

thesis.description: Podsol soils have been intensively studied ever since the middle of the last century, yet the mechanism of their development is still obscure. In view of this lack of knowledge regarding podsolization and because these soils are the dominant agricultural soils of Eastern Canada, an investigation of the fundamental processes responsible for their development was started at Macdonald Collage in 1947. [...]
thesis.creator: Coldwell, Blake Burgess.
thesis.subject: Agricultural Chemistry.
thesis.title: An Investigation of the chemical composition of the leaf-fall from deciduous forest trees before and after partial decomposition.

thesis.description: The demonstration of the value of colchicine as an agent for chromosome doubling has opened a large reservoir of possibilities in plant breeding work. Colchicine.

thesis.description: In the innumerable places in industry where heat is generated, applied, or dissipated, it must pass from some relatively hot body to one at a lower temperature. This particular physical phenomenon and the laws governing the molecular, electronic and wave motions involved is theoretically studied under the familiar heading of "heat transfer". [...]

thesis.description: The effect of varying the compression ratio of internal combustion engines has been well known for some years. Research engines have been built from time to time with the feature of variable compression ratio. The main difference of this engine from American and British internal combustion engines is that the fuel is injected into the cylinder in the "solid" state and the inlet valve admits only air to the cylinder. [...]
thesis.creator: Brown, Donald Robertson.

thesis.title: Calibration of variable compression internal combustion engine with standard fuel and investigation of performance with fuel 3GPX22.

thesis.description: The development of emulsion polymerization has been one of the most important steps in the evolution of a commercial synthetic rubber. The main advantage of this type of system lies in the degree of control over the polymerization reaction which it affords. [...]

thesis.description: With the increased use of weldments and other alternate methods of fabrication over the past few years, there has been much interest in the foundry industry in improving the quality and over-all reliability of steel castings. In recent years, also, the efficiency of the acid-electric steelmaking process for the intermittent operation peculiar to the industry has been reflected by an increasingly larger proportion of the steel used to make castings produced by this method. [...]

thesis.description: Cancer of the stomach is the most frequent of all malignant growths. Livingston and Pack in 1939 (121) have stated: "There are more deaths from cancer of the stomach than from all malignant tumors of lip, tongue, cheek, tonsil, pharynx, larynx, salivary glands, thyroid, male and female breast, ovary, uterine cervix and corpus uteri combined." [...]

thesis.description: An understanding of the mechanisms operating in nuclear reactions produced by high energy nucleons is of considerable interest. thesis.description: In 1916 Lanthrop and Loeb (l) demonstrated a diminished incidence of spontaneous mammary cancer in female mice of known high incidence strains as a sequel to castration. thesis.description: Great progress has been made by medical science today toward the successful treatment of many diseases so that they no longer present the same threat to man's existence. [...]

thesis.description: A recent study by Lansdell (20) demonstrated rather conclusively that deficit in performance on a 'closed-field' test of rat intelligence was very closely associated with degeneration in the lateral geniculate nucleus, the most reliable indication of loss in the primary visual system. thesis.description: This study is concerned with cancer patients who are cared for at home during some part or their teminal illneas. The problem of chronic illness and disability, of which cancer is only one major cause, is an ever increasing one. A higher incidence of chronic illness can be expected in the years to come because the life span has grown longer, and degenerative diseases become more prevalent as the individual grows older. [...]

thesis.description: The weave of life is a complexity of ethical and economic decisions.
